nodes.bodyText:
A particular reason for not using ZoneOffset.UTC here?
(we tend to use ZoneOffset.UTC predominantly)
nit: Class 'LessThan' has only 'static' members, and lacks a 'private' constructor
nit: verify picosOfMicro is in appropriate range (primarily to catch negative values)

commit.message:
Make tests single-threaded

These tests rely on shared state and need to be executed exclusively.
Simplify the tests by relying on TestNg's ability to run them in
single-threaded mode.

Use assertj for query assertions

This makes it possible to write assertions as:

    assertThat(assertions.query("<query>"))
        .matches("<another query>")

and add any other assertions that might be relevant using the power of AssertJ

Render timestamps as ISO8601 without a timezone

Timestamps do not have an associated timezone, so they shouldn't be
render with one attached.

Implement parametric timestamp type

Supports timestamp(p) with p in [0..12]

It introduces a 3-form representation:
* When p <= 3, it uses a long containing the number of milliseconds since the epoch. This
  makes it possible to maintain backward compatibility with existing connectors that rely
  on this encoding
* When 3 < p <= 6, it uses a long containing the number of microseconds since the epoch.
* When 6 < p <= 12, it uses a custom object containing a long+int

Provide backward-compatibility mode for clients

If clients declare they support the PARAMETRIC_DATETIME capability,
datetime types will be rendered with variable precision.

afterCommit.message:
Provide backward-compatibility mode for clients

If clients declare they support the PARAMETRIC_DATETIME capability,
datetime types will be rendered with variable precision.
